conclusion: Orange ball A freely falls onto the table where the block group is placed.
The orange ball A is above the table with blocks placed on it.
There are two yellow blocks, one green block, one orange block, and one blue block on the table.
As soon as the orange ball A reaches table height it meets the two yellow blocks, which are the only pieces lying in its flight corridor.
The faces of the yellow blocks are tilted toward the small gap between them.
The first contact is a glancing blow on the near-side yellow block.
That contact deflects A into the gap; a second brief contact is made with the far-side yellow block.
After these two touches the ball loses almost all horizontal speed and, under gravity, settles in the gap.
No later collision with the blue, orange or green towers occurs because the ball has already stopped.
Blocks hit: the two yellow blocks only.
Landing position: wedged and at rest in the small gap between the yellow blocks.
